subject: FE
text: Obtain expressions for efficiency and ripple factor of bridge rectifier with ideal diodes. Consider a bridge rectifier employing 4 identical ideal diodes with primary voltage 120V, 60Hz. If the turns ratio of the transformer is 5:1, determine the average and rms value of load voltages.

subject: FE
text:
A Si diode carries a reverse saturation current of 12nA at 20°C operating temperature. Find:
i) Diode current when it is forward biased by a voltage of 0.65 V.
ii) Diode current when the temperature rises to 100°C, using same forward bias voltage.

subject: FE
text: Given $V_Z= 6V$, $I_{Zmin} = 5mA$, $P_{Zmax} = 300mW$ and $R_s = 50Ω$ for a Zener voltage regulator, Find the range of load resistance for an input voltage of 9V.

subject: FE
text: With a neat circuit diagram, explain the working principle of self-bias circuit using MOSFET. Consider a self-bias circuit using MOSFET with R₁=5KΩ, R₂=12KΩ, Rs=1KΩ and VDD =1.8V. Determine the bias current by assuming $V_{TH} = 0.5V$, $μ_nC_{ox} = 100μA/V²$ and $W/L=4/0.18$. Also, determine the maximum allowable value of drain resistance (Rd) that can maintain MOSFET in saturation region.

subject: FE
text: Draw the structure of MOSFET and explain its operation. Also, with a neat diagram, explain the channel pinch-off phenomenon in MOSFET.

subject: FE
text: Draw the structure of MOSFET and explain its operation. Also, with a neat diagram, explain the channel pinch-off phenomenon in MOSFET.

subject: FE
text: With the help of a neat circuit diagram and relevant mathematical expressions, explain how an OPAMP can be used as a subtractor. Design an OPAMP difference amplifier circuit to obtain $V_{out} = 2(V_2 - V_1)$, where $V_2$ and $V_1$ are the inputs.

subject: FE
text: Consider a message encrypted as "1011001" using 7-bit even parity Hamming code and transmitted through a noisy channel. Decode the message, assuming a single bit error in the encrypted message received.

subject: FE
text: Simplify the given Boolean expression using K-Map and implement the simplified expression using NAND gates only. F(A,B,C,D) = Σm(1,3,6,7,9,12,15) + d(5,11,14)

subject: FE
text:
(i) Using Boolean algebra rules, show that: (A+B)(A+C̅) + ĀB̅ + ĀC̅ = A + B̅ + C̅

(ii) Design a half adder using basic gates.

subject: FE
text: Draw the logic diagrams of 4-bit SISO and SIPO Shift registers. Consider the data 1110 being input into a 4-bit Serial-In Parallel-Out (SIPO) shift register. If the data is entered starting from the Least Significant Bit (LSB), how many clock pulses are required to load the data into SIPO shift register.

subject: FE
text: Design a 3-bit ripple up counter using positive edge-triggered T Flip-Flops.

subject: FE
text: Explain the working principle of SR flip-flop with neat circuit diagram and truth table.

subject: FE
text: Implement the function F(A,B) = Σm(0,2,3)$ using a 4:1 multiplexer.
